gurmukhi: kw BXo mGvw blvMf hY Awj hau qwhI so juDu mcY ho ] Bwn pRcMf khwvq hY hin qwhI ko hau jmDwm pTY ho ]
transliteration: Kaa Bhayo Maghvaa Balvand Hai Aaj Hau Taahiso Judh(u) Machai Ho|| Bhaan Prachanndd Kahaavat Hai Han(i) Taahiko Hau Jamdhaam Padhhai Ho||
translation: “If even Indra comes today with full force, I shall fight also with him; Surya considers himself very powerful, I shall fight also with him and dispatch him to the abode of Yama;

gurmukhi: Aau ju khw iSv mY blu hY mir hY pl mY jb kop bFYho ] paurK rwKq hau ieqno khw BUp hÍY gUjr qy Bij jYho ]1826]
transliteration: Au Ju Kahaa Shiv Mai Bhal(u) Hai Mar(i) Hai Pal Mai Jab Kop Badhaiho|| Paurakh Raakhat Hau Itno Kahaa Bhoop Hvai Goojar Te Bhaj(i) Jaiho||826||
translation: “The powerful Shiva will also be destroyed before my fury; I have so much strength, then should I, a king, run away now before a milkman?”1826.

gurmukhi: ieau kih kY mn kop BirE cqurMg cmUM ju huqI su bulweI ] Awie hY SsqR sMBwr sBY sMg sXwm mcwvn kwj lrweI ]
transliteration: Io Kah(i) Kai Man Kop Bhario Chaturan Chamoond Ju Houtisu Bulaaee|| Ooe Hai Shastra Sanbhaar Sabhai San Syaam Machaavadkaaj Laraaee||
translation: Saying thus, the king in great anger addressed the four divisions of his army; the whole army got ready to fight with Krishna, holding the weapons;

gurmukhi: CqR qnwie kY pICy clXo niRp sYn sBY iqh Awgy isDweI ] mwnhu pwvs kI irq mY GnGor Gtw Gur kY aumfweI ]1827]
transliteration: Chhatra Tanaae Kai Peechhe Chadyo Nrip Sain Sabhai Tih Aage Sidhaaee|| Maanoh Paavas Kirit Mai Ghanhor Ghataa Ghur Kai Oumdaaee||1827||
translation: The army moved in front and the king followed it; this spectacle appeared like the thick clouds rushing forward in rainy season.1827.
Speech of the king addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: BUp qbY hir hyir kY AYsy kihE sunwie ] qU guAwr CqRIn so jUJ krYgo Awie ]1828]
transliteration: Bhoop Tabai Har(i) Her(i) Kai Aise Kahio Sounaae|| Too Guaar Chhatreen So Joojh Daraigo Aae||1828||
translation: Then looking at Krishna, the king said, “How will you fight with Kshatriyas being only a milkman?”1828.
Speech of Krishna addressed to the king:

gurmukhi: CqRI khwvq Awpn ko Bijho qb hI jb ju`D mcY ho ] DIr qbY liKho qumko jb BIr prY iek qIr clY ho ]
transliteration: Chhatrikahaavat Aapan Ko Bhajioh Tab Hijab Juddh Machai Ho|| Dheer Tabai Lakhioh Toumko Jab Bheer Darai Ik Teer Chalai Ho||
translation: “You call yourself a Kshatrya; I shall wage a war with you and you will run away; I shall test your endurance then, when you will be in trouble and will not be able to discharge even one arrow;

gurmukhi: mUrC hÍY Ab hI iCq mY igrho nih sXMdn mY ThrY ho ] eykh bwn lgy hmro nBmMfl pY Ab hI auf jYho ]1829]
transliteration: Moondachh Hvai Ab Hichhhit Mai Girho Nah(i) Syandan Mai Thahrai Ho|| Ekah Baan Lage Hamro Nabh-mandal Pai Ab Hiud Jaiho||1829||
translation: “You will just now fall unconscious on the ground and will not be able to remain firmly in your chariot; you will fly to the sky with only the blow of one of my arrows.”1829.

gurmukhi: ieau jb bYn khY biRjBUKn qau mn mY niRp kop bFwXo ] swrQI Awpn ko kih kY rQ qau jdurwie kI Er DvwXo ]
transliteration: Io Jab Bain Kahai Brij-bhookhan Tau Man Mai Nrip Kap Badhaayo|| Saarathiaapan Ko Kah(i) Kai Rath Tau Jaduraae Kior Dhavaayo||
translation: When Krishna said this, the king grew enraged in his mind and he got his chariot driven towards Krishna;
